item.title: U.S. Approves $11 Billion in Arms Sales to Taiwan, Angering Beijing
item.description: The packages include Himars truck-based missile launchers, howitzers, missiles and antitank drones.

item.title: Trump Tackles Concerns Over Taiwan Strategy With Massive Weapons Deal
item.description: The $11.1 billion sale came after a string of episodes that stirred disquiet about the U.S. president’s appetite to face down China.

item.title: Panama Ports Deal Hits Impasse as China Makes New Demands for Its Approval
item.description: Beijing threatened to block the BlackRock-led deal to buy ports unless state-owned Cosco gets a majority stake.

item.title: What to Know About the Use of U.S. Surrogacy by China’s Billionaires
item.description: A WSJ investigation shows how Chinese elites are building mega-families by using a largely unregulated American system.

item.title: Hong Kong Court Convicts Publisher Jimmy Lai, Whom Trump Has Vowed to Free
item.description: The 78-year-old symbol of China’s protest crackdown faces a possible life sentence.

item.title: China Vanke Shares Fall After Bondholders Reject Debt Extension Proposal
item.description: The property developer said it will hold a bondholder meeting on Thursday to discuss next steps.
